availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, attorney. Bourbon County, Kentucky, native. Married to Louisa C. Swope. Father of Mary C. Swope, George W. Swope, Sarah E. Swope, Henrietta C. Swope, Charles T. Swope, Martha Ann Swope, John S. Swope, and Samuel F. Swope. Attended Georgetown College in Georgetown, Kentucky. Attorney in Pendleton County from 1832 to 1865. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Pendleton County from 1837 to 1839. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Pendleton County from 1844 to 1848. Member of the United States House of Representations 1855 to 1857.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton, District 1, p. 350A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton, p. 261.

Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1877), p. 676.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Franklin Swope (1809-1865)," Memorial #11924609, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11924609 (accessed March 22, 2020).
